1 ^ Dòminus rèǧit me: 2 ^ In loco páscuaĕ ìbi me collocávit~; super aqŭam refecțiónis educávit me. ^ He hath set me in a place of pasture~; he hath brought me up to the water of refreshment.
3 ^ Ánimam meam convèrtuit~; dedúxit me super sémitas justìțiaĕ pròpter nomen suum. ^ He hath converted my soul~; he hath led me on the paths of justice for his own name's sake.
4 ^ Nam et si ambulávero in mèdio ùmbraĕ mortis
qŭóniam tu mecum es. Vìrga tua
column5: ìpsa me consoláta sunt. ^ For though I should walk in the midst of the shadow of death
column7: for thou art with me. Thy rod and thy staff

et nìhil déerit mìhi. ^ The Lord ruleth: advèrsus eos qŭi trìbulant me. Impingŭavìsti in óleo caput meum
column4: qŭam praĕclárus est. ^ Thou hast prepared a table before me against them that afflict me. Thou hast anointed my head with oil
column5: and my chalice which inebreateth me

1 ^ Dòminus rèǧit me: 6 ^ Et misericórdia tua subseqŭétur me òmnibus diébus vitaĕ meaĕ
et nìhil déerit mìhi. ^ The Lord ruleth: et ut inhábitem in domu Dòmini in lonǧitúdinem diérum. ^ And thy mercy will follow me all the days of my life
and that I may dwell in the house of the Lord unto length of days.
